intro: Agonandra obtusifolia subsp. conzattii, commonly known as the Conzatti's Agonandra, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features include a woody stem and small, persistent leaves. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
